detail_description: Agricola is a worker placement game about farming. Players take turns placing their workers on different action spaces, and can use these actions to plant crops, raise animals, and build buildings. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Caverna is a worker placement game for 1-7 players. Players take turns placing their workers on different action spaces, and can use these actions to farm, mine, build, and raise animals. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Le Havre is a worker placement game for 1-7 players. Players take turns placing their workers on different action spaces, and can use these actions to build ships, trade goods, and hire workers. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Catan is a game of resource management and trading. Players take on the role of settlers on the island of Catan, and must work together to build roads, settlements, and cities. The first player to reach 10 points wins the game.

Risk is a game of world domination. Players take on the role of leaders of different countries, and must use their armies to conquer the world. The first player to control all of the world's territories wins the game.

Small World is a fantasy-themed area control game for 2-5 players. Players take turns placing their meeples on different regions of the map, and can use these meeples to conquer new regions, fight battles, and collect resources. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Dominion is a deck-building game about collecting cards. Players start with a small deck of cards, and can use these cards to buy new cards, which they can then use to gain more resources and victory points. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

Ascension is a deck-building game for 2-5 players. Players start with a small deck of cards, and can use these cards to acquire new cards, creatures, and buildings. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Star Realms is a fast-paced deck-building game for 2-5 players. Players start with a small deck of basic cards, and then use those cards to acquire new, more powerful cards. These cards can be used to attack other players, defend themselves, or acquire even more powerful cards. The first player to reach 50 points wins the game.

Pandemic is a cooperative game about stopping the spread of disease. Pandemic is a cooperative board game for 2-4 players. Players take on the role of disease-fighting specialists who must work together to stop the spread of a global pandemic.
Forbidden Island is a cooperative game for 2-4 players. Players take on the role of explorers who must work together to collect four sacred treasures and escape from a sinking island.
Hanabi is a cooperative game for 2-5 players. Players take on the role of fireworks experts who must work together to create a beautiful fireworks display.
Codenames is a party game about giving one-word clues to help your teammates guess the words on your team's board. The first team to guess all of their words wins the game.

Telestrations is a party game about drawing and guessing. Players take turns drawing a picture, and then passing it to the next player. The next player then tries to guess what the picture is, and then draws a picture of their own. The game continues until all of the players have had a turn drawing and guessing. The player with the most correct guesses wins the game.

Just One is a cooperative word association game for 3-7 players. One player, the 'active player,' has a secret word in mind. The other players, the 'helpers,' must help the active player guess the word by giving one-word clues.

Monopoly is a game of property trading and negotiation. Players take turns rolling dice, moving around the board, and buying properties. Players can then rent out their properties to other players, and collect rent. The first player to go bankrupt loses the game.
Clue, also known as Cluedo in some countries, is a murder mystery game for 3-6 players. Players take on the role of detectives who must solve the murder of Mr. Boddy, the owner of a mansion.

Ludo is a game of race and luck. Players take turns rolling a die, moving their pieces around the board, and trying to be the first player to reach the finish line. The first player to reach the finish line wins the game.

Root is an asymmetric area control game about woodland creatures. Players take on the role of different factions, each with their own unique abilities. The goal of the game is to gain control of the forest, and the first player to do so wins.

game_name: Song of Ice and Fire: The Board Game
detail_description: Song of Ice and Fire: The Board Game is a competitive strategy game for 3-6 players. Players take on the role of Great Houses of Westeros, vying for control of the Seven Kingdoms.

Chess is a game of strategy and tactics. Players take on the role of two armies, and must use their pieces to capture their opponent's king. The first player to capture their opponent's king wins the game.
Poker is a card game of chance and skill. Players are dealt five cards, and must use these cards to make the best possible hand. The player with the best hand wins the pot.
7 Wonders is a card-based drafting game for 3-7 players. Players take on the role of leaders of ancient civilizations, competing to build the most prosperous and powerful empire.
Uno is a card game about matching colors and numbers. Players take turns playing cards, and the player who gets rid of all of their cards first wins the game.
Scrabble is a word game about spelling words. Players take turns placing tiles on a board, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
Boggle is a word game about finding words in a grid. Players take turns shaking a grid of letters, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
Jenga is a game about building a tower and then trying to remove blocks without knocking the tower over. The player who knocks the tower over loses the game.

The Resistance is a party game about trust and betrayal. Players are divided into two teams, the Resistance and the Spies. The Resistance must send out teams of three to complete missions, while the Spies must sabotage the missions without being caught. The first team to win five missions wins the game.

Avalon is a party game based on The Resistance, but with a different theme. Players are divided into two teams, the Good and the Evil. The Good must send out teams of three to complete missions, while the Evil must sabotage the missions without being caught. The first team to win five missions wins the game. In addition to the standard roles from The Resistance, Avalon also includes Merlin, a powerful Good character who can see the identity of the Evil players, and Morgana, an Evil character who can disguise herself as a Good character. This adds an extra layer of deception and intrigue to the game.

The Resistance is a party game about trust and betrayal. Players are divided into two teams, the Resistance and the Spies. The Resistance must send out teams of three to complete missions, while the Spies must sabotage the missions without being caught. The first team to win five missions wins the game.
